result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert D Fullerton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case settlement.

Defendant Robert D Fullerton in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant Robert D Fullerton in custody.  Lester H Liptak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF147, 16CF101.  State recites case settlement into the court record.  DE will enter plea's in 15CF147, 16CF101 both Ct's 1.  15CF146 will be DRI as well as Ct's 2,3,4 in 15CF147, 16CF101.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CF146-DRI  DE will pay restitution in the amount of $4900.00

15CF147-Ct's 2,3,4-DRI.  Ct 1- 6 years total, 2 years initial confinement/4 years extended supervision.  DE has credit for 92 days.  DE will enter a plea of G, court accepts finds DE G in each case. 


16CF101-Ct's 2.3.4-DRI.  Ct 1-6 years total, 2 years initial confinement/4 years extended supervision.  DE has credit for 114 days. 

  Sentences will be concurrent to each other/ concurrent to sentence DE currently serving.  DE will pay CC/provide a DNA sample/pay surcharge.  Uncharged cases C15-02921, C15-03000 and C2015-1803 will also be DRI.  

Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, will order 2 years confinement/4 years extended sup.  Restitution will be a condition of extended supervision.
